definitions.definition: to go up, or to go towards the top of something:
examples: The plane climbed quickly to a height of 30,000 feet.

definitions.definition: to use your legs, or your legs and hands, to go up or onto the top of something:
If a price, number, or amount climbs, it increases:
examples: Our costs have climbed rapidly in the last few years.

definitions.definition: to move into a higher social position, or to improve your position at work:
examples: He quickly climbed to the top of his profession.

definitions.definition: an act or process of climbing:
examples: We were very tired after our climb.

definitions.definition: a place or object to be climbed:
examples: The north face of the Eiger is a very difficult climb.
